name: Görschwin Fey
content: Görschwin Fey | ES HauptnavigationUnternavigationInhaltSuche search in website en de Biography Since September 2017 Görschwin Fey is a professor at the Institute of Embedded Systems at Hamburg University of Technology (TUHH). Görschwin Fey received his Diploma in Computer Science from Martin-Luther-University Halle-Wittenberg in 2001 and his Dr.-Ing. in Computer Science from University of Bremen in 2006, respectively. From 2012-2017 he headed the Department of Avionics Systems at the Institute of Space Systems of the German Aerospace Center (DLR) and the Group of Reliable Embedded Systems at the University of Bremen. His research interests in Electronic Design Automation (EDA) and automation of embedded system design focus on reliability, debugging, and design understanding. Activities (excerpt) 2013-2024 IEEE Symposium on Design and Diagnostics of Electronic Circuits and Systems (DDECS), program committee member 2011-2024 IEEE European Test Symposium (ETS), program committee member 2024-2029 Research Training Group CAUSE, joint with Univ. of Bremen and Univ. of Oldenburg, DFG 2024-2027 Di-ExViPaS, Designinitative Mikroelektronik, BMBF 2021-2025 Combining Testing and Monitoring for Online Functional Guarantees in Imprecise Hardware Systems, DFG, jointly with Prof. A. Garcia-Ortiz (Bremen) 2020-2024 Methodology, Algorithms, and Framework for Hardware Design Understanding, DFG 2010-2016 DSy – Debugging Eingebetteter Systeme (Debugging of Embedded Systems), DFG-funded Emmy Noether Group, University of Bremen 2011 Orchestrated Multi-Level Information Flow Analysis to Understand SoCs (my only YouTube video; created with great help of Lisa Jungmann (University of Bremen) for the DAC 2011 WACI session) Publications ORCID DBLP Position Professor Contact Details Görschwin Fey Tel.: +49 (0) 40 30601-3697 			Mail: Goerschwin.Fey(at)tuhh.de Building E, Room 3.026 Directions Consulting Hours On appointment 			(please send an email) 2024 Maximilian Schmidt and Swantje Plambeck and Görschwin Fey (2024).
